etymologies: early 18th century (in an earlier sense). From ancient Greek μελοποιΐα from μελοποιός maker of songs, lyric poet (from μελο- + ποιεῖν to make) + -ία; compare -poeia

definitions: Ezra Pound's term for: the musical and rhythmic qualities of poetic language, especially as suited to the tone or mood of the text. Compare "logopoeia", phanopoeia.
